intro: Heracleum stenophyllum subsp. angustatum, commonly known as narrowleaf cow parsnip, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants with hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant features a tall, slender stem that can grow up to 2 meters in height, often with a distinctive purple or reddish tint. Its leaves are deeply lobed, and it produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. This species is often found in moist meadows, stream banks, and other wetland habitats.
